meanings.definition: To make a hollow sound when an object hits a surface.
meanings.sent1: I heard the ball plunk against the wall.
meanings.sent2: She likes to plunk her keys on the table when she comes home.
meanings.sent3: The raindrops plunked on the roof like a drumbeat.
meanings.sent4: The acorns plunked down from the tree, one by one.
meanings.sent5: The coin plunked into the wishing well, echoing in the silence.

meanings.definition: To drop or place something heavily and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: He would plunk his backpack on the floor after school.
meanings.sent2: The chef would plunk the vegetables into the boiling water.
meanings.sent3: She decided to plunk herself on the couch after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The heavy raindrops plunked onto the windowpane.
meanings.sent5: The worker would plunk the bricks into place, one after the other.

meanings.sent1: The plunk of the hammer hitting the metal echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The old car made a loud plunk as it hit the pothole.
meanings.sent3: The plunk of the coin dropping into the piggy bank made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The plunk of the anchor hitting the water signaled their arrival.
meanings.sent5: The plunk of the metal ball hitting the target was satisfying to hear.
